answers.answer: My situation is exactly like yours, I had three c-sections and was adviced to not have anymore.  But I am pregnant now and have to have another c-section.  My doctor does not seem to be concerned.  My 3rd one was a little rough, they put the epidural way to high in my back and it caused alot of problems, but other then that it went fine.  I would much rather a c-section the vaginally

GD yeah gestational diabetes I see you had it with all yours so there is hope for me having another baby I didnt want hubby and I to rush into any harsh decisions and your proof number 3 can be possible well number 4 for you good luck you might have a girl this time as long as the baby is healthy thats the main thing my friend had 4 c sections and was advised not to after 2 but all is good with her and her babies she didnt have the gd tho take care.
My friend had GD with her first two, both c-section, the third time she didn't have GD!!! Ofcourse this was a c-section as well.
I have 2 boys, both born by c section. I am pregnant again and will have another c section.
I just had my third c-section on September 8th...
My aunt has had 3 c-sections and my friends mom has had 4 and both of them had no complications afterwards.

question: I had GD with my first pregnancy and it ended in a Csection due to failed induction I have GD in my current pregnancy and are now 35 weeks a C section is booked for me on the 15th Nov I was just wondering if anyone has had GD twice and 2 C sections and gone back a third time my midwife has advised me not to have anymore children as its high risk im 28 and it was a shock to hear that but im very lucky to be having two healthy girls and happy with 2 children but have been asked if I want my tubes tied when I have c section im very scared because im under 30 I dont think I'll get it done hubby is 33 and said hes happy to get the chop but I dont want him to rush into that either any advise would be great thanks.
title: GD Twice and C section Twice has anyone went for a 3rd time
